Draft @ Founders (from notes).  Pours a hazy amber color with a small off white head.  The aroma is sweet caramel, bourbon, with addition sweet maple and wood.  The flavor is pretty much Curmudgeon with the addition of more sweetness from the maple barrels.  Medium plus to full bodied; caramel, bourbon, wood, hints of earthy, and sweet maple syrup.  There are hints of alcohol in the taste, but it serves mainly to warm as it goes down.  The imperial pint I received from the generous server was almost too much to handle.

Sample at NOTB 2011.
Appearance : Hazy pale amber.

Aroma : Sweet caramel with light peachy notes. 

Taste : Hops with peachy notes Sweet caramel with nice maple syrup. Nice sugary finish. Quite woody with a nice bitterness.

Overall : Nice woody finish. Nice sugary finish. Rather well balanced.

Red / Brown pour. Aroma of wood, whiskey, caramel and candy.

Honey, dark fruit flavor with a bourbon and oak splash. Good!

On tap as part of a sampler at Founders Brewery in Grand Rapids, MI.  Appearance like maple syrup with virtually no head.  Aroma of alcohol and maple syrup, almost medicinal, super potent.  Taste makes me shiver.  Super rich and boozey, dominated by the maple syrup and alcohol, as I was writing this I noted - holy hell theres no way I can finish this one and survive the 2 hr drive home through the snow.  Little did I know it wouldve been a 3 hr drive!  But anyways, I couldnt even finish the small sample at the Brewery, just too much alcohol flavor mixed with the maple syrup.  Not really something I enjoyed.

Last drink of the first night of RBSG 2010. Travelled back from HopCat with manic rater hopscotch to stuff in another brew. Another unworldly brew by founders - this is just nuts. 
Monster aroma, very sweet and milky, wild fruit, more tropical, maple, vanilla, wood kinda sounds like the others. 
Tastewise this is another super sized brew.  Willl this end? Creeeeeeeeeamy as anything, thick sweet choc and vanilla, wood, not quite syrupy dark fruits, maple, Natives of the new Dawn are just ripping this place apart! What beats this place??? Some alc.  Well, quite boosy. Milky and probably nutty. Its 1:30 and Im trashed. Man this beer is too much of a good thing as I cant see drinking another. Im already totally bloated and this massive sweet bomb is just too much to handle at this point. Gave the rest of my beer to a crazy looking bearded lunatic sitting next to me who turned out to be CanIHave4Beers.

Tasted on draft at FoBAB 2010.  Pours a clear bright orange with an average white head that leaves some nice lacing behind.  The nose is cinnamon and other baking spices, vanilla, oak, and maple, but the spices dominate.  The flavor is vanilla, oak, allspice, caramel and brown sugar.  The body is full with average carbonation and a long spiced and vanilla finish.

Pours bright ruby with a nice white dad and lacing. Nose is a bit rich. Caramel and fried banana are the initial scents. Slight sweetness. Taste is quite sweet. Caramel and candied fruits. Slight banana. Mouthfeel is rich and only slightly hot. This will age very nicely.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 09-04-2010

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2012 Draft sample at FOBAB 2010.  Pours a clear amber-gold color with almost no head.  Notes of honey, vanilla, caramel, bourbon, mixed fruits, and maple syrup.  Medium-full bodied, with a sticky, syrupy mouthfeel and low carbonation.  Not bad, but very, very sweet.  Good luck drinking a full glass of this anywhere. Re-Rate: Wow, totally forgot about the FOBAB rate. Damn. Thought this was a new one. Got a 750 ml Better Half bottle from stevemastny of BeerDownload fame- thanks again, Steve! Im bumping up my rating on this one from the old 3.4. It still isnt as good as advertised but better than Id said. Pours a nice amber color, mostly clear but with a ton of yeast sediment. The aroma and flavor start subdued, with notes of maple, honey, vanilla, molasses, caramel malts, dried apricots, and wood- pretty one-dimensional. Medium-bodied, with a smooth mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Definite warming booze throughout. Better Half reveals eventually reveals her charms but you need to get damn near room temperature before it happens.
tap at fobab.   cloyingly sweet.  honey.  boozy.  sticky sweet, underattenuated.   syrupy.   okay in half ounce samples, but hard to finish even 3 ounces.

Iced tea colored pour with  a small, dense, white head.  The aroma is alcohol, maple, damp toasted oak, and some smoky bourbon.  The flavor is maple syrup, bourbon, butterscothc, lots of fusel alcohol, clover honey, toffee, a hint of smoke, and a little spice and pepper on the finish.  Its hot like 09 Nemesis was fresh, but not quite as cloying.  Sticky, medium body with soft carbonation.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a lightly hazed, deep orange-red colored body with a creamy, finger-width, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves lots of pretty lacing thats easily aroused with a swirl. Very pretty. Aroma is nice and very sweet. Big on the sweet caramels and maple syrup with a distinct bourbon backing. Citrus oranges make themselves present as this warms along with some earth. Flavor is sweet. Lots of maple syrup with some caramel and bourbon. Some butter to the malts and a light oakiness along with a light citrus orange. Finishes with a bit of an alcohol oakiness and very sweet malts. Slowly dries with a moderate bitterness masked by the sweetness. Lengthy aftertaste following a full, smooth body and very light carbonation. Overall, a very enjoyable, sweetly aged old ale. Well balanced throughout and easy drinking. Glad to have sipped at the pub.
Tap @ Founders for RBSG10 - arouma is piney hops and a touch of citrus dry hoppy with wet booziness and vineous. some earthyness and maple sweetness to round out the edges.

On tap at Founders a couple months ago.  Reviewing from notes.  Golden color with a white head.  Aroma is maple and sweet with a decent amount of alcohol coming through.  Very pleasant though.  Taste is great!  The maple blends very well with the old ale style.  Very, very good.  I had a few of these before we left.  Looking forward to having it again.

Draft at Founders.  Pours a reddish amber.  Very small white head.  No lacing.  Huge bourbon aroma.  Flavor of bourbon with some vanilla and caramel.  Thick sticky sweet palate.  Stong mouthfeel.  This was definitely a sippin beer.  Overall a nice beer, but I would pick the regular Curmudgeon if I had to chose.

On tap at Founders while in town for RBSG.  Pours a ruby and crimson brown with a thin white head.  Huge whiskey and vanilla on the nose, toast and a bit of raw alcohol.  Remarkably smooth however, loads of vanilla.  Smooth and toast malt.  Toast and vanilla on the finish.  For something that initially came off smelling a bit hot, the alcohol was dangerously well hidden after that.  Really good.

On tap at Founders.  Poured hazy medium garnet with a tall, fluffy beige head.  The aroma picked up sweet, darker fruity notes, maple, and aged caramel, with bourbon and vanilla delicately laced throughout.. warm and inviting.  The flavor found lots of darker fruits, maple syrup, vanilla, and caramel at the core.. light, dry earthy bitterness around.. finished a tad tart with a solid dose of barrel and warm sugars.  Medium-plus bodied on the palate with lots of sugars balanced against lots of barrel.. complex and very enjoyable!

Draft at Founders. Why the hell this is called Kaiser is beyond me, but Ill roll with it. Pour is a murky and deep amber with a sticky head. Nose is strongly rich with some light smoke and bourbon notes. I dont get a ton of maple, but just a enough to mute the bourbon character. cookie dough and marshmallows as well. On taste, definitely reminiscent of Curmudgeon. Notes of burnt sugar, sweet caramel. Not enough bitterness to really pull it all together. Interesting, but doesnt hold a candle to Looking Glass.

Draft RBSG 2010 Cloudy, dirty orange ale with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. Olfactory-wise, caramel, rye whiskey and oak are the real standouts. Suggestion of maple syrup. Full-bodied with a buttery mouthfeel and lively carbonation. The flavor is  mainly sweet and presents notes of rye whiskey, maple syrup, caramel and oak. Sweet, sticky, syrupy finish.

Kaiser curmudgeon. 12oz pour at founders... Pours a darker amber  
caramel brown with a thin soapy white head... Sweet and syrupy caramel  
upfront with dark fruits playin a back up role... Flavors lend  
themselves to much of the same with the major focus on the sweet honey  
maple with a fair share of bitterness but remains predominantly sweet.  
Dark fruit on the backend...Body is smooth with mild to active  
carbonation.
8/4/7/4/15

Draught at the brewery, RBSG 2010.
Smooth as silk. Huge whiskey and vanilla aroma and flavor with caramel. Big, smooth, sweet, lovely. Over the top whiskey flavors.

Big thanks to Vertical Bacon Strips for walking up to me at founders and handing me half a glass of this! The color is a deep red and the beer has a small head and some lace. The aroma is boozy with some cherry and a lot of vanilla, there is some malty sweetness, and some distinct ice cream cone! The flavor is very sweet with plenty of vanilla, some bourbon and a nice pleasant alcohol bite. Tasty but I didnt want more than half the glass, I guess Jeff didnt either!

On tap at the brewpub. Poured a thick hazy dark amber with a near white head that lasted. Aroma was full of syrup and seemed to over whel the curmudgeon a bit. I did get some caramel on the nose. Flavor was quite full of syrup as well, but the curmudgeon did poke its head out in the finish with caramel and sweet grains. Overall a bit too sweet for my liking.
On tap at Founders. More maple syrup than Canadian Breakfast had, thats for sure. Good but sweeter than hell. Rich caramel at 1.15...no idea what that means but it is what I intended to put. Hot.

On tap at Founders. Ruddy orange-red body, thick cream head. Sweet, rich nose, with brown sugar, caramel, breads, and dark fruits, also bubblegum and vinous notes. The body is very sweet, with maple, caramel, brown sugar, and cotton candy, becoming cloying after a few sips. The last two or three ounces were dominated by oak and alcohol.

Draft on tap at the brewpub (Grand Rapids, MI). RBSG Kickoff! Pours a murky dark amber, darker with a huge near beige head that stays big and laces well, cakes. Very large. Aromas are a candy like bourbon and maple syrup, caramel, toffee, and biscuits mix, light florals, a decent dryness, with sweet lingering. Very scotch like. Initial moves into sweet caramel and toffeez, scotch and bourbon, a touch of peat mixes with vanilla, toffee, decent bitterness, sweet caramel and toffee, biscuits, good boozy kick, a dryness and sweetness combine with a nice Scotch-Bourbon like feel, vanilla and grains, sweet yet boozy. A nice kick. A sweeter more Barleywine like feel. Tasty, a bit sweet overall. A tasty bourbon beer, malt and sweet forward but a bit too tough to put down en masse. A nice beer with a big sweetness.

Draft at Founders during RBSG 2010. Pours deep red/amber, medium off-white head, ropey lacing. Nose is bourbon, red fruits, some caramelly malt, really dominated by the bourbon. Flavours are again bourbon-dominated, more red fruits, toffee, oak, milk chocolate. Good.

Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a lightly hazy dark copper color with a large creamy, tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of primarily huge scotch whisky notes with some faint notes of cocoa and peach. The taste is coconut, whisky, caramel, a buttery note and faint stone fruits. Medium-full bodied. Nice beer.

On tap @ the brewery. Pours orange amber with beige head. Rich malts alcohol doughy creamy and enticing.  Sweet malts candied fruits, maple syrup,  sugar, and  red fruits. Touch of alcohol candied sugars.  Sweet but solid.
Tap founders, pours amber small head, nose is butterscotchy and bourbon, vanilla flavors butterscotch, vanilla , bourbon caramel. Tasty with some heat. Good stuff.

Really oaky nose, just a bit of maple, lots of toffee and dark fruit. Taste is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lots of toasted oak, vanilla, lots of dark fruit, plenty of toffee and maple syrup on the backside. The finish is extremely tannic with a shitload of oak that really detracts from this being a decent sipper. Not in the same class as the other maple barrel aged stuff from Founders.

Draft. Poured dark clear brown color with a minimal frothy light brown head that mostly diminished with little lacing. Moderate to heavy sweet malt, wood and small bourbon alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy bourbon sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet and small alcohol finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer and I thank Michael Bell for getting this put on to try.
From the tap and Founders Taproom. Dry almost wine like finish. Definatley has a alcohol tinge to it. Really cant detect any maple. Good beer but not great. Still good and worth a try.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2010 base curmudgeon aged on founders famous maple barrels. amber body with small white head. this beer is huge in vanilla, oak, sugar, hot hops, and maple. wonderfully sweet, with out being cloying. had this side by side with the original version. the maple aging cuts down the slight alcohol bite from the regular one. this is one of the best old ales i have ever had. awesome.
